The cost of compute: A $7 trillion race to scale data centers

AI is fueling high demand for compute power, spurring companies to invest billions of dollars in infrastructure. With future demand uncertain, investors will need to make calculated decisions. Compute power is emerging as one of this decade's most critical resources, with data centers projected to require $6.7 trillion worldwide by 2030.

  • AI boom
  • capital expenditures
  • Investment in compute power and AI infrastructure
  • Uncertainty about future demand and ROI
  • Limited visibility into future demand
  • Informed investment decisions
